Subjective: Headaches for 2 months. Increasing frequency. Nausea, glare, and preference for dark room. No vomiting. No flashes of light. No trauma. No radiation to neck/arm. No numbness/tingling. Social: Student, 20 years old. Lives alone. No smoking/alcohol/drugs. ICE: Worried about cause and best treatment.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50/min. Neuro: Cranial nerves fine. Fingertip-nose test good. Arm and leg strength good. Romberg's normal. Vision: glare, no flashes.
Assessment: Migraine, likely. Ruled out: Cluster headaches.
Plan: Start pain relief as soon as symptoms start: paracetamol 4x2, ibuprofen if necessary.
Return sooner if symptoms worsen or change.
